snippet: Public defenders representing a son-in-law of Osama bin Laden have asked a judge not to hold an earlier trial because automatic government budget cuts are requiring furloughs in their office.
lead_paragraph: Public defenders representing a son-in-law of Osama bin Laden have asked a judge not to hold an earlier trial because automatic government budget cuts are requiring furloughs in their office.

headline.seo: Lawyers for Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, Bin Laden’s Son-in-Law, Request Later Trial
headline.main: Citing Cuts, Lawyers Seek Relief in Terrorism Case
headline.print_headline: Citing Cuts, Public Defenders Seek Relief
